MJs5-NUgN9t31C93BGtjMw.text: I took some friends here for dinner and wanted to give this place a try since I am in the area fairly often. We were looking forward to a nice dinner with drinks and conversation with some ambiance. This place fell short, especially on the service. The facilities were pleasant and comfortable, the menu was typical standard fare, the food quality was average, and the service was poor. The server (Scott) did not seem to want our business - unfriendly while we were ordering, didn't bring our drink order - we had to ask someone else to follow up long after our food had been served, and then a while when he finally later he brought out drinks, he forgot one of the four we had ordered nearly a half hour before. After that he never came back to check on so refills. When he finally came by he groaned a single one surly word: Dessert? We had hoped to have a casual dinner with a couple of drinks or wine; but by the end with the unfriendly vibe from the waiter, we were happy to just pay the bill and leave. This place is not on the repeat list for me.

D8gfPpPT_J0DMmd4S-cptg.text: Friendly & quick service! Good recommendations on wine. Food was good, but nothing noteworthy. I would say its a classic 90s upscale grill- nothing modern about it. Menu is extremely limited.

3E2aMECaELZt1Ii-uTroMw.text: I don't understand these less than stellar reviews.  I have been twice, so far, and both times were absolutely great!  The fried lobster bites are awesome, so was the house smoked salmon.  My husband thought the filet may be the best steak he has ever had, and he has eaten plenty.  The duck breast special was delicious.  Everything was just perfect, including the temperature of the red wine.  It was the perfect temperature, a little warmer than cellar temp, but not  a too warm 70+ room temp. Dining outdoors was delightful.  We will definitely be back soon.

9bo51LxMZw4EkzOE6VXc_w.text: Great for lunch and dinner.  FYI they also have brunches on Saturday and Sunday and it rocks

DrDK25tE957chI_Hr_3mWA.text: Been here twice-Once for dinner and once for lunch. Not sure which was more disappointing. Lunch of salad with grilled salmon included microscopic piece of overcooked salmon wilted salad and flavorless dressing. Dinner slightly better but I wouldn't rush to try this place. Also, seems way overpriced for what you get...

VfqBt2wH6KgqpMY379gvfA.text: Been here twice which is 1 time too many. Matt, the waiter is a definite asset to this restaurant. Food is marginal at best, the facility is aesthetically pleasing. The manager was void of personality & the owner is worse!

Cem-MKgrAx_U2-V-6PDfiA.text: My wife and I were there last night. We had a fantastic meal. The service was spot on as well. My wife had the crab cakes and I had the prime rib both were excellent. We will be back soon.

GSHetbtqTWAP4TVPsnUVdg.text: May want to ignore the negative reviews here.  Great food, great atmosphere, good service.  Prime Rib was fanastic, Gnocchi was fanatastic, cocktails were solid. It's a huge space with a great layout...outdoor patio...large bar area.  Classy without being pretentious.  Will return.

HIwZvCRiaHVdmMj1GV_fcQ.text: The atmosphere was great. I got the chicken and waffle. It wasn't my favorite but it was a good experience.

sB-gjrq34h94cGnLxaOr0g.text: Decided to have dinner here last night with friends our server Joe gave us excellent service. The oysters Rockefeller was so fresh and welled prepared. I got the chicken entree and the chicken  was well executed by the chef and kitchen staff the chef made me a sauce they didn't have on the menu and I appreciate that kind of service I will be returning back soon. Keep up the good work

VyLSeiqXBGWzm85i5Hv23Q.text: Great location. Nice outside seating. Nice restroom area. Great bar. Drinks were made perfectly. I had the French dip sandwich it was amazing. The beet salad was plain and lacked flavor. The chocolate cake was good, but nothing to really write home about. Good service. Nice place for an evening out with friends & family. Would be great for date. I'll go back.

tvZW7btoh0iYvnF3fJ5JlQ.text: My husband made a reservation here on Sat night. We arrived about 15 min before our allotted time. The restaurant was beautiful and the decor was amazing. The food was pretty delicious. I had the pork chops, creamy mash potatoes and asparagus. A table of 6 were right next to us and they were loud, drunk and belligerent seemingly. That was pretty annoying because the area we were seated in was pretty small. The waiters were not friendly AT ALL! Almost seemed as if they did not want to be bothered. Not sure if I'll return.

S1Z46X4av0PPZh8hzdmgBg.text: Great place. I had the pork chop special and my girlfriend had a salad with salmon. The salmon was cooked perfectly. The pork chop was awesome!. Very tender with wonderful flavor. Nice size portion. Great South Park location but off the beaten path. Very nice outdoor dining area. The service was great.

hMHtr-iSkQQKZvxL2nHA8w.text: Met some friends from work for cocktails and shared 6-7 plates, all of which were on point, great beer and wine list and service was as good as it gets. We will be back!

VOC754JqL2uUozHJE9-o8A.text: Had a birthday celebration with family and friends at the South Park Grill. It was out first visit and we had a good time...  The cocktails were delicious - the South Park Old Fashioned was essentially a basic old fashioned but with rye and brown sugar... The Basil Smash was bright and not too sweet. Good wine list and a the bar area was lively. The main dining room was pretty loud but fun.  The lobster bites appetizer was disappointing - overcooked to the point if being chewy. The prime rib was really nice, whipped potatoes were cold when brought to the table but tasty. Had a taste of the gnocchi and the filet, both really nice.  Highly recommend sharing the chocolate cake.  Service was prompt and professional but you could definitely tell it was the last service on what had been a busy weekend evening.  I'll give it another shot.

oXIjOjxC6p-ndzHDCgFlPg.text: Saturday date night-  I had prime rib and wife had the salmon.   Both were delicious.  Her beet salad was awesome--to the extent that she let me taste it!  Service from our waiter Brian was flawless.  This was our first visit, but we will return.

38OcySyGWAs8iPdm5N_pxA.text: Four of us went to SouthPark Grill at 6:45 on a Wednesday night. When we walked in, we noticed that the restaurant was not crowded.  The young hostess walked us to a back room, with no windows, and tried to seat us in the last booth in the room. We asked her if we could sit out front where the windows were, and she said all the booths were reserved for parties of six. The funny thing was, the booth we were standing by, while she checked with her manager, had only four women.  Not a good start... After finally being seated in the front room, we had a very nice male waiter.  He had a great personality and was very informative and courteous. He was training a new waitress, and she was also very courteous and personable.  Now to the food...I ordered a salad with grilled shrimp. It was ok, but basically all lettuce.  It had very light toppings and only three shrimp.  We ordered oysters Rockefeller which were a highlight. My friend ordered a rare cheeseburger, and it was medium at best.  Also ordered was a French dip sandwich, and it had very little meat and too much bread.  The French onion soup was good as were the grilled scallops.  The wine and service were both good.  So, with the seating problem, and the so-so food, we will definitely not return.  There are too many restaurants in Charlotte to come back to the SouthPark Grill.

hRvHr_jYjtdLo8NF5Xhk-A.text: I'll give this stop a solid 4. We really enjoyed our specialty drinks and time socializing at the bar before moving into dinner.  Dinner was delicious starting with the seafood tower, onto a beet salad and we each ordered separate dishes to sample and share; sea bass, filet and the shrimp gnocchi, rounding out the night with the chocolate cake!  The sea bass was the star of the evening.  Our server was great, but there was a little too much time from our drink orders and time to table.  I think that may have just been side effects of a crowded bar with live music no less on PGA tourney week.  All in all a really nice night!

xEQSSU4_JP9kNUq6lPgksw.text: Had to downgrade my prior 5-star review after last night's experience. If 3.5 stars were an option, I would have rated it that, but didn't have the heart to do 3 stars due to management being nice and receptive. My main issue last night was our server. Myself, husband and another couple friend went to Southpark Grill and after being seated, it took a bit of time for our server to come over. When he did, we all felt he was rushing us and that we were kind of a bother to him. Not friendly at all. From there, it was just mistake after mistake. While the management and other staff that were helping to bring out food and such were very nice and apologetic, our server was not until the very end when it was time for the checks. Drinks were slow/wrong, salad wasn't brought before entree and then when it finally was, had the wrong dressing, one of the two med-rare filets was very rare, and it was frustrating that our server's attitude was crappy. One line of his was particularly annoying when while my friend was ordering her drink, he said "Can you hand me that dirty fork?" and then she had to repeat her drink order because he wasn't listening. French onion soup was still amazing, charcuterie board, oysters, bone-in ribeye and filet were great, but my husband's NY strip was a bit tough. Overall, the service left a bad taste in our mouths. Probably will try again, but likely not anytime soon.

mcYPQuUb6Kx7P3STJBBzoQ.text: Awesome food. Beautiful place. Pete, the bartender is outstanding and worth going back just for his impeccable service.  Lobster bites are unbelievably good!  Shrimp cocktail one of the best I've had. Great drinks!

iT2seZrmtY_E0DelpsC2ag.text: First time, went here with wife. Parking was easy, we were sat kinda of sat in the back which was definitely quieter. Started with the French onion soup, very good. server recommended the Chilean sea bass, now I'm a huge fan of this. There's was bland, it came over a bed of couscous which I wasn't a fan of but that again was bland. Portion size was about half that of say Ruth's Chris but within $4 of RC price. Scale of 1-10, 10 being great, 5-5.5. Chef really needs to experiment with pairings for this because it could have been much better. Wife had the filet. They butterflied it and the weird thing about this was one side was they way she wanted it (well), the other medium rare. We also had the broccolini which was underdone and once again, bland. We will try it again as we would any place because they could have just had a bad night but like this again and they won't be seeing us or the $400 dollars we spent, Stopped by the bar as well, bar scene wasn't bad but they need more than one cognac in the place. Oh, at bar we had the Charcuterie Board which was decent. Need a better selection of cheeses at least have goat cheese or some brie.

ldQyZ8Mkyi_Eudc9sPFqJw.text: If you are looking for a plain-jane unimaginative and very forgettable, yet very expensive, restaurant experience look no further. Our group was looking for a special restaurant for a Christmas gathering, but we were frustrated and ended up getting salads at the table. We ate quickly and decided to move on.

96z6jEDdIpM2w3a2U8s7fA.text: This place is PRIMO! We loved everything about this restaurant. The hubs and I went in for our anniversary and were very happy. The service was on point, the food was great, even the owner can by and spoke with us. He made us feel like we were sitting at his dining room table. Not too invasive, but put such a personal touch on our evening. I defiantly recommend trying this place. 10 out of 5 stars!!!!!!! (Get the lobster bites and hand cut ribeye!!!)

p4_8JeWTDa5YDi13fKPh4A.text: Beautiful restaurant, great ambience, enjoyed sitting outside listening to Frank Sinatra era music. Our server was good.   The food was unexpectedly poor. We ordered shrimp cocktail and beet salad as starters. The shrimp smelled fishy, the ends looked dirty and the veins were only partially removed. The beets had no flavor and the kale left a bad taste in your mouth.  Entrees were not great. My husband ordered the pork chop medium rare, it was overlooked, dry and flavorless. My prime rib was good but the whipped potatoes were bland. The worst thing we ordered was the chocolate cake.  It's was hard and had very little flavor. We sent it back.  That was our first visit and we will not be going back.

rFYWN2nK3H8G660i5bFOxg.text: Service was fine, if they seated me any further away, I would have been in the parking lot. burger was well done, asked for medium. Won't be going back.

EjNT_hwTRlp2796jH4W9uw.text: Update: Decided since it has been awhile we would give SG another try. The service was worse the second time around. Our waiter seemed annoyed that we were there. The timing of food was terrible. They brought apps without plates,  brought out our entrees before salad and when we told them our waiter acted annoyed and said he'd bring them. We didn't want them after getting our entrees. After, the food was bland and uninteresting. Even the manager tried to argue with us about the service and food quality. WHAT? Well, when the check arrived they took of our entrees off the bill so the evening out didn't hurt as bad as it could have. We will pass on SG going forward.   We went last night for our anniversary and were so disappointed. We started with an appetizer and asked for the oysters rockefeller plain and they came warm. After, our salads were fine BUT the charred ceasar is a kale ceasar that is not charred. Our entrees were the worst...my husband ordered the filet and it was so tiny and bland served with basic fries. It was NOT comparable to any filets that you can get for almost the same price else where. My chicken was ok but served with greasy rice and overcooked broccolini. As for dessert we passed and didn't even get a Happy Anniversary from our waiter. Luckily the night was saved by stopping by DelFrisco's after where they treated us to dessert & an amazing port!

photos.caption: Photo of SouthPark Grill - Charlotte, NC, United States. Hot oysters
Photo of SouthPark Grill - Charlotte, NC, United States. Bland filet with fries
Photo of SouthPark Grill - Charlotte, NC, United States. Chicken was ok but the rice was greasy &amp; overcooked broccolini!

joN4BwQARM6NkaTw542Aaw.text: Came here for dinner on a weeknight. They have a parking garage behind the place or you can valet your car. This place was quiet and had a decent sized crowd. We had a reservation and when we entered we were greeted and then seated. The waiter was rude and didn't listen at all.  He was horrible. My sister ordered the crab bisque and when it arrived I commented it looked good so he has the manager being one for me..... that I ended up paying for. I didn't ask for it. Food came out and he never checked on us. He went over specials and had no eye contact and looked disinterested in even working. He seemed disinterested in serving us overall I had to ask manager for a box to pack up food or basic water. The crab bisque was missing something and lacked flavor. The Rossi's were chicken was a big portion but the chicken was bland and the broccoli was over cooked. The mashed potatoes were okay. My sister didn't finish her fish sandwich and thought it lacked flavor. So we didn't order dessert or try the drinks. It wasn't a good experience at all. The location is nice, but food isn't good at all. They have some work to do and I probably won't return.

photos.caption: Photo of SouthPark Grill - Charlotte, NC, United States. Crab bisque
Photo of SouthPark Grill - Charlotte, NC, United States. Fish sandwich
Photo of SouthPark Grill - Charlotte, NC, United States. Rotisserie Chicken

Gps9NK7C1lfHVbA0DIKjOQ.text: Just had a great anniversary dinner there! Julia a very sweet hostess sat us at a great booth. Our waiter Mathew did a very great job making our night special.  We had the Lobster bites to start, excellent little morsels coated just right. My wife had the large beet salad for dinner, the beets were pickled just right and the salad had a great balance. I had the thick cut pork chop, chef cooked it perfect to my order, the chop was juicy and flavorful. The reduction had a hint of peppercorn and was great to swab each bite.  Apple Cobbler to finish a great night. Thanks to the staff for a great experience.

photos.caption: Photo of SouthPark Grill - Charlotte, NC, United States

K1_uiVVC1LK7lcfRNDi79Q.text: The proteins are very good - you're on solid ground there. But the sides offered with entrees on the current  menu  - the salmon and Rib eye in particular- leave a lot to be desired. My recommendation is to go a la carte and NOT order the entrees as currently composed.

INoyWvZLxEGP-uoBGAI2ag.text: I do not understand why the overall rating is below 4 stars.  We have been here twice and have enjoyed our meals, drinks, and service each time.  The location, free valet, and the quality of the experience make it a great spot.  Give it a shot.  I doubt you will be dissatisfied.

X7M2KUh3FFw407ZsrjZ7DQ.text: Had driven by a couple of times, so we decided to give this restaurant a try. We sat at the bar for drinks and dinner. The wine menu was adequate. The timing of the food being served was great. Allowed us to finish our salads before the entrees arrived. We ordered the halibut and osso bucco. The halibut was tough and over cooked. We mentioned this to the server. She said it was pan fried and walked away. Osso bucco was just ok. I would have given this establishment 4 stars, because maybe we just picked the wrong dishes that night, but the reason for the 3 stars was the service and the experience. The bartender/ server seemed like she would rather be anywhere then there. Her attitude almost made us feel uncomfortable like we were just bothering her. She barely looked you in the eye when asking if you wanted another drink. We barely could get out a yes or no before she walked off. I understand if she has something bigger going on in her life, so I hesitate to leave reviews, but we won't be going back. For the price point, there are so many other places we'd rather go that has better service and food.

1ByxsXJnRyvpfPaypHJELA.text: Super hidden gem.   The cocktails were on point !   The meal was exceptional especially the scallops and Macintosh scalloped potatoes! The prime rib was too generous for one meal but delicious.  On pretty evening dine under a canopy of trees or relax for brunch in the cool shade.    Repeat, repeat, repeat...

photos.caption: Photo of SouthPark Grill - Charlotte, NC, United States
Photo of SouthPark Grill - Charlotte, NC, United States

nSs6S0MWTEtoQYKD-CACIw.text: This is a great South Park gem! Interior has private booths and is nicely decorated. Bar also has seating and TV if you want to catch a game or a score. Great menu and wine list- salads are my favorite- add the salmon and pair with the Pinot Noir or the Sauvignon  Blanc. Our service has always been exceptionally good and it's overall a great value!

CpJBB_cTjnd9YAJ0woT3LQ.text: Christmas Eve at the Southpark Grille was fabulous! It's located behind Piedmont Row, tucked away and was alittle difficult to find. Classy, high end restaurant with a pleasantly tranquil environment.  I had the Chilean Sea Bass with truffle dusted fingering potatoes. It was a thick, perfectly cooked 6oz. piece with a nicely seared outside and moist on the inside. It came with a couscous side but I changed it out for the potatoes, which were beautifully seasoned. ($40) And my dirty martini was spot on, too! One friend had the NY strip and it was a big, thick cut cooked perfectly to her requested medium temp. It pared well w.their garlic mashed. She arrived early & had lobster bites and said they were out of this world....and she's a picky foodie. Another friend had some pasta and shrimp dish, which he loved. I could see the shrimp were a good size, too! We split their chocolate cake for dessert, which we found to be tasty (chambourd & chocolate) but it was dry. So, I didn't care for the texture. Even tho we had to ask for bread they were attentive about refilling the basket. I rate service as excellent. My rating is 5. In addition to the dining areas there is a very nice sized, beautiful wood carved bar. I will definately be going back! Can't wait to try their oyster rockerfellers!

JJwgzzTurAGQ59WVihHIMQ.text: I have been to South Park Grill three times.  The first time I sat at the bar and had a Lobster Roll.  I thought twice about ordering a $22 Lobster Roll but figured at a high end restaurant like this it had to be wonderful...Surprise, it was fair.  The Lobster had no flavor, no seasoning and was cold, right out of the refrigerator.  The next time I came in for Sunday Brunch.  My son ordered shrimp and grits which was not tasty.  My son has a big appetite and he would not eat them.  We ordered the jalapeno cheddar biscuits which were nothing special.  I could not even taste the jalapenos or cheddar cheese and they were not  even warm.  The other dish we ordered was avocado toast with shrimp and I really loved it.  In fact the next time I went I ordered it at the bar and it was not nearly as good and I will not pay $20.00 for that dish again.  The bartenders are friendly and efficient.  The Manager is present and attentive but the food is marginal and I will just go for the expensive drinks at the bar from now on.  It's a beautiful place but they need to work on the food.

PRSUu97nFjNQbP0qqlC8EQ.text: I've been a couple times. Once for lunch and another time for happy hour. At lunch I had crab cakes and an appetizer that I can't remember. The crab cakes were good.  They were priced at $30+ though. Especially at lunch just thought too expensive for crab cakes and fries. Awesome service from the waitstaff though.   Happy hour ordered an old fashioned and it was essentially a Shirley Temple with a dash of bourbon added for color.  Easily the worst drink I've ever had served to me at a bar that didn't smell like stale beer. Got a bourbon on the rocks after that and called it a night.   With Village Tavern right across the street serving a broader menu at lower prices with a better bar I'd just go there.  Not sure how this place will differentiate itself and stay in business with those prices.

InY2H7Y8hK8ctMc418JcBA.text: Ok you can tell that they would like to be awesome. Lots of friendly servers. Went on a Saturday night. Wasn't very busy despite having few reservations available on open table. Good wine options. I had a solid prime rib sandwich. Sides all very good. Good but nothing memorable.

sAn-l2XXs6-DEjFNCfWE8w.text: I've eaten here several times and the food and service has been excellent. I've had lunch, brunch, and dinner here and enjoyed each visit.  We recently celebrated a special occasion and our group was somewhat larger than expected, but the management and servers took everything in stride and made our evening perfect.

-V3a0JVP4euLeVu_d6iS8Q.text: We went on a warm winter night and they gave us the option of eating indoors or outdoors.  We had a 7:30 reservation.  We chose inside and were given a cozy booth.  Our waiter was knowledgable and attentive, and not too attentive.  She ordered a French, made perfectly, not too sweet and froth on the top.  I ordered a classic and there were tiny ice chips on top.  Perfect.   Oysters as our appetizers were chilled and tasty.  She ordered the sea bass.  It was excellent.  I ordered the pork chop medium.  The outside was very good, the inside was cold and absolutely raw.  Not pink.  It was uncooked.  This upset my date and she asked that I take it back.  Sometimes you just want an evening to go without incident and so I didn't make a fuss.  I left half of the pork chop and it was clear that it was uncooked.  The waiter took no notice.  Unfortunate, but the rest of the meal was so good and I definitely was not hungry, we still gave it an 8.5/10.  We ordered carrot cake to go.  It was a sizable portion and still good when we ate it at home.    For the price, things could gave been better, but with so few fine dining choices close to our home we will give this place another chance to cook their food more thoroughly.

74TYjRQkKoDHkwYjeqXwMw.text: My wife and I love this place. I cannot say enough good things. The setting is nice, they have a great patio, the service is always top notch, the management is awesome, and the food is great. They have the best salad I have literally ever had in my life. The Park Salad is phenomenal and that is an understatement. Everything about it rocks. I always get it with the Fried Oysters and they are incredible. The dressing is a honey vinaigrette that  I desperately want the recipe for. They also put goat cheese and pecan brittle in there as well. The pecan brittle will change your life. Not kidding. Try it!

CrCnx_sg7xspew7Pcc2sIQ.text: Came here to celebrate my 25th birthday, the food was excellent! Matthew took great care of us and it was a great experience!

s-1H5AiXzRP5xP_dxD6C6g.text: Delicious!! Best salmon I have ever had!!!   so good.   The black rice, awesome.  The bok choy was not good. Very stringy. Could not cut it or chew it. I got it stuck in my throat.    Squeezing 6 people in the booth was a little to close for comfort.

k7Z805LPo13BHl4VS_DULA.text: The whole meal from start to finish was impeccable. Our server Matthew was very knowledgeable and friendly. Highly recommend the carrot cake! We will be returning.

iszgmTRQc8cr8mZId1lnIQ.text: If you're of color do not got to this restaurant. I was told there was an hour and a half wait when there was at least 5-6 tables open.  I would give zero if it was an option.

nD5mMBRvDfpsmCcHKHTyNw.text: Went here for lunch and got the lamb sandwich with fries. Was shocked by how expensive everything was and so was expecting my meal to be incredibly delicious and worth the money. Sandwich was ok but nothing I would ever crave again. Fries were horrible. Limp and tasted like they'd been frozen and heated. Only bothered to eat a few. So disappointing. Would never recommend this place. So many other options and places to try.

ZFW_P4NJFNhY-mYYzkaITQ.text: Really enjoyed this place. Service, food and atmosphere is flawless. We had the crawfish beignets, Caesar sad w shrimp and I had the porterhouse steak. DeliciOSO! Loved the flavor of the shrimp especially. Steak was cooked medium and medium it was with that great grilled flavor. Loved their signature sauce too. Nothing bad to say. I will certainly be returning.

fke2_68A0Ttk3cv3pCcLow.text: Let me first say, we love this restaurant and have been here twice, in the dinning room for dinner. The food is great and the wait staff is always friendly.  My husband and I wanted to have a drink while we waited for friends to get into town for the fourth of July holiday. All other bars/restaurants in the area were busy the Wednesday before 4th of July in southpark. The Grille was not busy at all, maybe 10 people in the place. The valet person stated "you have to go into the restaurant, you can't just park here for the fireworks". We weren't there for the fireworks, and thought "that's strange on how he greeted us". we walked up to the bar and the older bartender (Mark)stated "let me guess, you are here for the fireworks, and going to have one drink", my husband and I looked at each other surprisingly and said no. he was rude and was rude to the other customers. He also said a off color race comment that offended me. when we paid our tab, he took my money and didn't give me change. when I asked for change, he rolled his eyes. I left him 1.50 tip because I was so put off with him.  If you do not want customers who you THINK are going to watch the fireworks, you should close for the night or do not be rude about it.Won't be back for a while.

qFluuXkNl60tJCWiDWfZvQ.text: I am going to start of immediately and say that Quentin(manager) is and was very rude to our Group of Women this past Saturday Night(8/10). We had a reservation for 9:30 but arrived around 8:15-8:30pm and asked could we still be seated. And yes we were because the restaurant was empty besides a family of 4 or 5. The restaurant closes at 10 so we were happy we got there before time. Quentin instructed the hostess on where to seat us(behind the family of 5). He turned out to also be our Server. From the time we had any questions and ordered, Quentin was very short with us and not welcoming at all. He did give us some insight about the sides but we had to inquire about the Fish of the day amongst other things. He wasn't very forthcoming. We ordered. I ordered the Salmon which was ok, my girlfriend ordered the Pork Chop and as per usual when we dine out we sample each other's food(it was 5 of us). Immediately I tasted her Pork Chop and told her it was salty, she said yes I thought that too. She then gave another friend a piece and she had the same reaction. Eventually when Quentin came back she told him about the saltiness of the PC. He immediately asks her "well what do you want me to do about it?" If you would've said something before you finished I could have done something about it! What!!!!!! There clearly was meat on the PC. We each had a sliver. You couldn't finish it because your pressure would've been sky high. So she asks for the manager, and clearly stated that she is going to pay for her meal, that she just wants to let them know that the food is salty. Quentin states he is the manager. And still was rude. Ok so fast forward to him coming back to bring another drink that I ordered for a friend because she didn't want to deal with his rudeness, another friend ordered the Crab-cakes which tasted like fish cakes. There were two of them, she ate half of one. He asked her was she done, she states yes and tells him she didn't like them. Bill time!!! He removes the crab cakes from her bill and the PC from the other meal. He brings out my cake, they sing to me. Gathers their cash and cards to pay for the meal and my Pork Chop friend asks Quentin was it too late and possible to order a soda to go?  Old Mr. Quentin says No, but then rolls his eyes as he's walking away from the table. We are through at this point and it's closing time. Quentin never said thank you to us as he did the table of Five seated in front of us. He addressed that man by his name. He said "have a good evening Mr. so and so". But our group of 5 Women he just turned on the lights!!!!! How freaking rude.

photos.caption: Photo of SouthPark Grill - Charlotte, NC, United States. Trio of lobster bites, fried oyster and Calamari. This was good
Photo of SouthPark Grill - Charlotte, NC, United States. Them nasty crab cakes
Photo of SouthPark Grill - Charlotte, NC, United States. Nice Decor

6G-uDZG0sgM_81FS2anwgA.text: Cheers to Yelp for another solid recommendation. A friend and I decided to grab brunch after a workout class and the place caught our eye.   We were seated immediately and I ordered a mimosa. Because...what's brunch without champagne?   For my meal I ordered the egg white omelet. It comes with spinach, mushrooms and peppers then gets topped with avocado . I added cheese and selected the hash browns (more like mini potatoes) as my side.   The portion size was small. But the food was really good! The omelet was cooked to perfection and the potatoes were very tasty!   Everything was very good, I only wish I had more. I would recommend giving this place a try!

photos.caption: Photo of SouthPark Grill - Charlotte, NC, United States. Egg White omelet with hash browns

WczsveadRKHZMIjXs2zZWA.text: So it's not the cheapest option by any means.... however, my office is nearby and I absolutely LOVE the cobb salad here. It's a well run place and they're always quick to make things right (that goes a long way). I do like that you can occasionally spot some popular panthers players dining with their families and the place becomes abuzz with fans pointing... LOL. The French onion soup is by far the best I've had in Charlotte - it's a meal in itself, so beware if you order it, you won't be hungry for much else after you devour it. :) Avocado ranch dressing is what salad dreams are made of. YUM!

WFnqoqFcBchs8BUQGAXZBA.text: This is a delayed post as I am new to yelp.. but we came in for dinner on a Saturday evening around 9:30  Drinks Appetizers Entrees Another drink And as we were finishing up my husband asked for a dessert menu.:. Our server responded with "Im sorry everyone in the kitchen has left, we could MAYBE cut you a piece of cake." WHAT???!!! So we came in with the intention of having a full meal on the rare occasion we get a date night AWAY without our kiddos and want to end our meal with dessert and after spending $150+ for 2 there is no one left in the kitchen to make a dessert??!! There were still several tables left in the establishment I might add.  And coming from working in the industry (fine dinning at that) we would NEVER  tell a guest that information firstly, and secondly a manager would always be more then willing to accommodate a guest especially at this caliber of a restaurant. Dumb founded.

photos.caption: Photo of SouthPark Grill - Charlotte, NC, United States. Osso buco
Photo of SouthPark Grill - Charlotte, NC, United States. Heirloom Tomato salad with arugula and mozzarella
Photo of SouthPark Grill - Charlotte, NC, United States. Filet wedge

KfZz3YW5RdOTPgwO4t7dmg.text: One of our favorite places, but DO NOT get the truffle fries.  Unfortunately we ordered two of these sides for the table.  Not only could we not eat them, they were just plain awful.  They were way too salty and that truffle flavor was horrendous.  I have never met a French fry that I didn't like, until this meal.  French fries are spectacular without much extra attention!  We love everything else here, that's why the fries were an even bigger disappointment.   Avoid at all cost.  Hopefully I have made my point!  On a positive note, get the pumpkin cheesecake.  It is spectacular. It probably won't be available forever here. I am sure it is a seasonal dessert.

photos.caption: Photo of SouthPark Grill - Charlotte, NC, United States
Photo of SouthPark Grill - Charlotte, NC, United States
Photo of SouthPark Grill - Charlotte, NC, United States

74ccelEaO2by0jmKqExlGw.text: We stumbled upon SouthPark Grill during lunch recently. The interior is beautiful and it felt warm and inviting. The waitstaff is amazing. The lunch menu features a nice variety without overwhelming you with options. On the day my visit I opted for the French onion soup with the small beet salad and I added fried oysters.   That salad and fried oyster combo was amazing! My teenage son had the turkey burger with fries which he enjoyed as well.

85FEK9XYd25ovPyqcbQnNw.text: I was invited in for a complimentary tasting for neighborhood ladies. I have been wanting to try it out but haven't had a chance. We started with lobster bites, flatbread and onion rings - the lobster bites were a must order item for an appetizer. Next we had a sampling of their park salad - the homemade peanut brittle sets this salad apart.  Scallops, chicken and waffles and brussel sprouts rounded out our tasting menu. Will definitely be back for a date night or happy hour to hit up their 1/2 price wine night, atmosphere is dressy casual to business attire. The location is great and they offer valet parking.

-y9XC3kGsbe-5QwQtFW1_g.text: Great food and drinks. Great place for a private dates night. Recommend the pork chop and sixteen seventeen drink!

photos.caption: Photo of SouthPark Grill - Charlotte, NC, United States. Pork chop

NxKSyJeiud0LQNLXQCn99Q.text: I've eaten at SouthPark Grill twice this week - weekend brunch and a special invitation wine/food tasting.  Both times the food and service were great.  I particularly loved the salad with arugula and the most incredible house made pecan brittle topping.  It's my new favorite salad!

photos.caption: Photo of SouthPark Grill - Charlotte, NC, United States. Lobster bites!

Y6NoBX4BOyNjYUxLSjyg4w.text: South Park Grill is not the easiest to locate in the pouring rain.  A couple of ppl in our party did not make it because w/the rain they could not see the signage so drove into the parking garage & thought that their GPS had directed them to the wrong place.  If they have a door from the parking garage to the establishment besides the service entrance direction to it would be greatly appreciated.     All the dishes were good but for the price point nothing stood out as outstanding.  Mushroom ravioli & the calamari & crab appetizers were solid performances.   Def say that increased signage maybe for the valet to indicate there is one when the weather is vision limiting would be a bonus.

I4E8uChLFagihJLn9aNcOA.text: Ordered the crab cake starter, truffle fries with carrot cake as dessert and a bottle of Riesling. Delicious!

gidA0SAanpHjW5X1D7QIJw.text: Great! Cocktails were absolutely amazing and a bar tender was very attentive and even had a few good jokes. Lobster bites appetizer was delicious! And the whole atmosphere is very classy and nice. Definitely coming back Ps great place for a date, very intimate

caWxx9oTouxRE9NQnjtZcg.text: Saturday Night was Chelsea and I's first time at Southpark Grill and my expectations were exceeded. To start our cocktails were fantastic, especially the Sorghum Sour, a solid take on the classic whiskey sour. The Lobster Bites, however, took things to a whole new level! Incredible appetizer! Things continued in that same fashion with both Chelsea's Porcini Pappardelle, and my Filet. Finally the Pumpkin Cheesecake hit the mark, as I am a huge dessert connoisseur! Service was also very good! Excellent experience all the way around!

photos.caption: Photo of SouthPark Grill - Charlotte, NC, United States. Lobster Bites just set the mood!
Photo of SouthPark Grill - Charlotte, NC, United States. Filet finished with Onion Jam!
Photo of SouthPark Grill - Charlotte, NC, United States. Incredible Pappardelle!

p4Dw6-W3mx-sD3NUmkQTTQ.text: If you haven't been to SouthPark Grill all other restaurants appreciate it!  Once visited it will become your favorite!!!  Enjoy the delicious piping hot French Onion Soup or the Goat Cheese salad w Pecan peanut brittle. Both can't be beat for beginning your experience.   The Halibut on parmesan risotto was delicious and my husband enjoyed the Salmon!    Service was outstanding.  Very private seating. The bar area looked inviting. Truly a great experience.

lQczrMx11NVJnSM4gFDGhw.text: Finally made it to this delicious restaurant for a business lunch.  We all had the French Onion Soup and a salad.  It was incredible!!  The service was spot on as well, great atmosphere!

3yUAf7_RU_By8xIIFx2-XQ.text: My friend held a brunch here so we were in a private room. The restaurant just walking through was nice and the room we were in was big enough to seat a good 30+ ppl. I ordered the Prime Rib Hash with a fried egg on top which was recommended by our waiter and it was so delicious! I also had a Bellini that was very good, I wanted another but for $11 one would do. The staff was great and checked on us often enough not to interrupt what we were doing but enough to make sure we were always good and didn't need anything. Everyone liked their food for the most part, just the chicken and waffles has a maple chili glaze on it (which it states on the menu) and a couple of the ladies weren't to fond of it so my suggest is just get it in the side if you want to try it. As far as parking, there's a parking garage that is connected that's free.

photos.caption: Photo of SouthPark Grill - Charlotte, NC, United States
Photo of SouthPark Grill - Charlotte, NC, United States

Eog8gQ-sVl7MI_tGUpveUw.text: I give them 3 stars...it would be less if it was not for Marybeth and the valet...  We arrived... Pulled up, a young man opened the door for my wife... polite as could be...  Walked in... Told the hostess of or reservation, she proceeded to walk us to the rear of the room...as I told her I would like to sit closer to the windows...she slapped her hand down on the table grabbed the menus and started walking toward the area I requested. When we got there she began to sit us in front of the wait station and again I said I want closer to the windows (it was still light out and we wanted to enjoy the dusk)...she again slapped her hand on the table to grab the menus, sat us where I suggested and walked away in a huff (a note for the management - she is the blonde in need of an attitude adjustment that was working this evening).  The service... Our server, Marybeth was excellent...knowledge of the wine list and menu, attentive, perfect timing...  The wine list... Adequate.  The food... Prime rib...very tough! NY Strip...tough! But the potatoes, broccoli and asparagus...perfect.  Our exit... Again...it is all about the service...the valet was polite, he asked the right questions, he was all about "the service"!!!  Our desert to go... Chocolate cake...best part of the meal!!!  I will give them the benefit of the doubt...they are new...hopefully they will work through the growing pains, hire the right staff and perfect the menu.   WE WISH THEM THE BEST OF LUCK.

photos.caption: Photo of SouthPark Grill - Charlotte, NC, United States

jFqAqc-zyr5ls_I05UpVvQ.text: Outdoor patio pleasant setting for conversation and for pet friendly.  Food terrific.  Wait staff very good.  Food on expensive side but delicious.
